deeptrees.model

deeptrees.model.deeptrees_model

class deeptrees.model.deeptrees_model.DeepTreesModel(in_channels, architecture='Unet', backbone='resnet18', lr=0.0001, mask_iou_share=0.5, apply_sigmoid=False, freeze_layers=False, track_running_stats=True, num_backbones=1, postprocessing_config={})[source]

Bases: LightningModule

__init__(in_channels, architecture='Unet', backbone='resnet18', lr=0.0001, mask_iou_share=0.5, apply_sigmoid=False, freeze_layers=False, track_running_stats=True, num_backbones=1, postprocessing_config={})[source]

DeepTrees Model

The model consists of a TreeCrownDelineation backbone, plus added functionalities for training, fine-tuning, and prediction.

Parameters:

  • in_channels – Number of input channels / bands of the input image

  • architecture (str) – segmentation model architecture

  • backbone (str) – segmentation model backbone

  • lr – learning rate

  • apply_sigmode (bool) – TODO

  • freeze_layers (bool) – If True, freeze all layers but the segmentation head. Default: False.

  • track_running_stats (bool) – If True, update batch norm layers. If False, keep them frozen. Default: True.

  • num_backbones (int) – If > 1, instantiate several TCD backbones and average the model predictions across all of them. Defaults to 1.

  • postprocessing_config (Dict[str, Any]) – Set of parameters to apply in postprocessing (predict step). Default: {}.

configure_optimizers()[source]

Configures the optimizer for the model training. If freeze_layers is set to True, logs the names of the parameters that will be trained. Creates an Adam optimizer with the learning rate specified by self.lr, filtering out parameters that do not require gradients. :returns: A list containing the configured optimizer. :rtype: list

Same as torch.nn.Module.forward().

Parameters:

  • *args – Whatever you decide to pass into the forward method.

  • **kwargs – Keyword arguments are also possible.

Returns:

Your model’s output

classmethod from_checkpoint(path, architecture='Unet', backbone='resnet18', in_channels=8)[source]

Load a model from a checkpoint file. :type path: str :param path: The path to the checkpoint file. :type path: str :type architecture: str :param architecture: The architecture of the segmentation model. Defaults to “Unet”. :type architecture: str, optional :type backbone: str :param backbone: The backbone of the segmentation model. Defaults to “resnet18”. :type backbone: str, optional :type in_channels: int :param in_channels: The number of input channels for the segmentation model. Defaults to 8. :type in_channels: int, optional

Returns:

An instance of the model loaded from the checkpoint.

Raises:

NotImplementedError – If the checkpoint cannot be loaded using the provided method.

predict_step(batch, step)[source]

Perform a prediction step on a given batch of data. :type batch: :param batch: A tuple containing the input data and the transformation information. :type batch: tuple :type step: :param step: The current step number, used for saving prediction outputs. :type step: int

Returns:

A dictionary containing the extracted polygons and, if active learning is enabled,

the mean and median entropy values.

Return type:

dict

This function performs the following steps: 1. Runs inference on the input data to generate output predictions. 2. Extracts mask, outline, and distance transform from the output. 3. Saves the predictions if configured to do so. 4. If active learning is enabled, calculates the probability map and entropy map, logs the mean and median entropy,

and saves the entropy maps if configured to do so.

  1. Extracts polygons from the mask, outline, and distance transform using the specified postprocessing configuration.

  2. Logs the number of polygons found, inference time, and post-processing time.

7. Returns a dictionary containing the extracted polygons and, if active learning is enabled, the mean and median entropy values. .. note:

- The function contains TODOs for using raster tile names and rasterizing outputs.
- Additional postprocessing steps and trait extraction can be added as needed.
shared_step(batch, iou_feature_map=False)[source]

Perform a shared step in the model training or evaluation process. :type batch: :param batch: A tuple containing input data (x) and target data (y). :type batch: tuple :type iou_feature_map: :param iou_feature_map: If True, calculate the IoU for the feature map. Defaults to False. :type iou_feature_map: bool, optional

Returns:

A tuple containing the following elements:

  • loss (torch.Tensor): The total loss combining mask, outline, and distance losses.

  • loss_mask (torch.Tensor): The loss for the mask prediction.

  • loss_outline (torch.Tensor): The loss for the outline prediction.

  • loss_distance (torch.Tensor): The loss for the distance prediction.

  • iou (torch.Tensor): The combined IoU of the mask and outline.

  • iou_mask (torch.Tensor): The IoU of the mask.

  • iou_outline (torch.Tensor): The IoU of the outline.

  • iou_fmap (torch.Tensor, optional): The IoU of the feature map, if iou_feature_map is True.

Return type:

tuple

test_step(batch, step)[source]

Perform a test step on a given batch of data. :type batch: :param batch: The input data batch. :type batch: Tensor :type step: :param step: The current step number. :type step: int

Returns:

A dictionary containing the following keys: - ‘mask’: The mask output from the model. - ‘outline’: The outline output from the model. - ‘distance_transform’: The distance transform output from the model.

Return type:

dict

to_torchscript(method='trace', example_inputs=None)[source]

Converts the model to TorchScript format using the specified method. :type method: :param method: The method to use for converting the model to TorchScript.

Currently, only ‘trace’ is supported.

Parameters:

example_inputs (tuple or torch.Tensor) – Example inputs to be used for tracing the model. Required if method is ‘trace’.

Returns:

The TorchScript representation of the model.

Return type:

torch.jit.ScriptModule

Raises:

ValueError – If an unsupported method is provided.

training_step(batch, step)[source]

Perform a single training step. :type batch: :param batch: The input batch of data. :type batch: Tensor :type step: :param step: The current training step. :type step: int

Returns:

The computed loss for the current training step.

Return type:

Tensor

Logs:

train/loss (float): The overall training loss. train/loss_mask (float): The training loss for the mask. train/loss_outline (float): The training loss for the outline. train/loss_dist (float): The training loss for the distance. train/iou (float): The Intersection over Union (IoU) metric. train/iou_mask (float): The IoU metric for the mask. train/iou_outline (float): The IoU metric for the outline.

validation_step(batch, step)[source]

Performs a validation step during the training process. :type batch: :param batch: The input batch of data. :type batch: Tensor :type step: :param step: The current step in the validation process. :type step: int

Returns:

The computed loss for the validation step.

Return type:

Tensor

Logs:

val/loss (float): The overall validation loss. val/loss_mask (float): The validation loss for the mask. val/loss_outline (float): The validation loss for the outline. val/loss_dist (float): The validation loss for the distance. val/iou (float): The Intersection over Union (IoU) metric. val/iou_mask (float): The IoU metric for the mask. val/iou_outline (float): The IoU metric for the outline. val/iou_feature_map (float): The IoU metric for the feature map.

class deeptrees.model.deeptrees_model.TreeCrownDelineationModel(in_channels, architecture='Unet', backbone='resnet18', lr=0.0001, mask_iou_share=0.5, apply_sigmoid=False)[source]

Bases: LightningModule

__init__(in_channels, architecture='Unet', backbone='resnet18', lr=0.0001, mask_iou_share=0.5, apply_sigmoid=False)[source]

Tree crown delineation model

The model consists of two sub-netoworks (two U-Nets with ResNet backbone). The first network calculates a tree cover mask and the tree outlines, the second calculates the distance transform of the masks (distance to next background pixel). The first net receives the input image, the second one receives the input image and the output of network 1.

Parameters:

  • in_channels – Number of input channels / bands of the input image

  • architecture (str) – segmentation model architecture

  • backbone (str) – segmentation model backbone

  • lr – learning rate

  • apply_sigmoid (bool) – If True, apply sigmoid function to mask/outline outputs. Defaults to False.

forward(img)[source]

Same as torch.nn.Module.forward().

Parameters:

  • *args – Whatever you decide to pass into the forward method.

  • **kwargs – Keyword arguments are also possible.

Returns:

Your model’s output

deeptrees.model.distance_model

class deeptrees.model.distance_model.DistanceModel(in_channels, architecture='Unet', backbone='resnet18')[source]

Bases: LightningModule

__init__(in_channels, architecture='Unet', backbone='resnet18')[source]

Distance transform model

The model is the second part in the tree crown delineation model.

Parameters:

  • in_channels (int) – Number of input channels

  • architecture (str) – One of ‘Unet, Unet++, Linknet, FPN, PSPNet, PAN, DeepLabV3, DeepLabV3+’

  • backbone (str) – One of the backbones supported by the [pytorch segmentation models package](https://github.com/qubvel/segmentation_models.pytorch)

forward(img, mask_and_outline, from_logits=False)[source]

Distance transform forward pass

Parameters:

  • img (torch.Tensor) – Input image

  • mask_and_outline (torch.Tensor) – Tensor containing mask and outlines concatenated in channel dimension, coming from the first sub-network.

  • from_logits (bool) – If set to true, sigmoid activation is applied to the mask_and_outline tensor.

Returns:

Model output of dimension N1HW

deeptrees.model.inference_model

class deeptrees.model.inference_model.InferenceModel(model)[source]

Bases: Module

Just a wrapper to apply the sigmoid activation to mask and outlines during inference..

__init__(model)[source]

Initialize internal Module state, shared by both nn.Module and ScriptModule.

forward(x)[source]

Perform a forward pass through the model. :type x: :param x: Input tensor to the model. :type x: torch.Tensor

Returns:

If the model output contains two elements, returns a tuple (y, metric) where y is the output tensor with sigmoid activation applied to the first two columns, and metric is the second element of the output. If the model output contains only one element, returns y with sigmoid activation applied to the first two columns.

Return type:

torch.Tensor or tuple

deeptrees.model.segmentation_model

class deeptrees.model.segmentation_model.SegmentationModel(in_channels=4, architecture='Unet', backbone='resnet18')[source]

Bases: LightningModule

__init__(in_channels=4, architecture='Unet', backbone='resnet18')[source]

Segmentation model

A segmentation model which takes an input image and returns a foreground / background mask along with object outlines.

Parameters:

  • in_channels (int) – Number of input channels

  • architecture (str) – One of ‘Unet, Unet++, Linknet, FPN, PSPNet, PAN, DeepLabV3, DeepLabV3+’

  • backbone (str) – One of the backbones supported by the [pytorch segmentation models package](https://github.com/qubvel/segmentation_models.pytorch)

  • between. (one means only the mask loss is relevant. Linear in)

  • **kwargs – Keyword arguments are also possible.

Your model’s output
